posts.content:
NUGGET wrote:Hi Rick, does the chassis number match ?


Chassis number matches m plates, m plate codes are all correct to actual bus.

Rick T wrote:My birth certificate arrived yesterday one year after ordering it, problem is none of the information match's my bus or the m plates on my bus, will have to email them today. Need to get motivated, not done anything for ages on the bus. Loads I could be getting on with while at paint shop, just need to get back into it.

err maybe question was. .

Are the VIN plate numbers correct on the birth certificate and you have answered do they all match on the bus?

Is that correct?

G

type21f wrote:
Rick T wrote:My birth certificate arrived yesterday one year after ordering it, problem is none of the information match's my bus or the m plates on my bus, will have to email them today. Need to get motivated, not done anything for ages on the bus. Loads I could be getting on with while at paint shop, just need to get back into it.

err question was. .

Are the VIN plate numbers correct on the birth certificate and your answer. ..
Does not seem to match what you said...here..

G


Vin plate numbers are correct on birth certificate, They match my chassis and vin plate, but my vin plate States mouse grey/pearl white, birth certificate says Turkish/blue white, also some other stuff wrong
Here's the number in the engine bay and vin plates

Notice I thought my reply was a little rude!
So changed it...
I thought the paint codes were somehow a variable and relied on the VW employee writing them down correctly..
They are working from microfiches of the paper records. .
Some details have been lost..
Water damaged etc or record un readable...

type21f wrote:Notice I thought my reply was a little rude!
So changed it...
I thought the paint codes were somehow a variable and relied on the VW employee writing them down correctly..
They are working from microfiches of the paper records. .
Some details have been lost..
Water damaged etc or record un readable...


It also says it's a type/model 211 on the certificate???
Right I'm back on it, after probably a month of not doing anything, decided to start cleaning and repairing my door locks. Maybe a little too much though!!
Got a email back from Roswitha at VW today regarding my birth certificate, basically put all wrong info on from another bus apart from chassis number, going to send me another one straight out
A year to get my first birth certificate, a week to get my second
Not done a update for a while, had some stuff blasted today and acid etched
Tried putting some new clips onto the wheels with new tool Westy Mick gave me the other day, had to weld up a hole in the end to get a better finish on the rivet, but turned out pretty well
Hey Rick . This is the finish on the rivets you get if you don't weld the hole up . It's difficult to make a tool in a lathe without the hole as the centre is not actually spinning .
I did what you said, cut about 3/4 mm off those rivets and it gave me a really nice flat finish on the inside, with no grinding
